title: Achilles Tendinopathy Rehabilitation
content: Achilles tendinopathy involves degenerative changes of the Achilles tendon. Treatment emphasizes eccentric strengthening exercises, activity modification, and proper footwear. Heavy-load eccentric training has shown significant efficacy. Adjunct therapies include extracorporeal shock wave therapy and platelet-rich plasma injections for refractory cases. Surgical intervention is reserved for cases failing 6 months of conservative management.
